text: no cookie box would be complete without
some version of a chocolate chip cookie
right so today I'm making a chocolate
chip toffee oatmeal cookie so great and
such a great complement to all the other
cookies that we made this year for our
Hokey Week start off by measuring two
and a quarter cups of all-purpose flour
that add a half a teaspoon of baking
soda three-quarters of a teaspoon of
fine salt if you're using coarse salt
then just use a teaspoon and a half
whisk it together you can set that aside
for a second while you get your butter
mixture ready in my mixer I have two
sticks of unsalted butter room temp add
a half a cup of sugar granulated sugar
and three quarters of a cup of light
brown sugar dark brown sugar would work
as well we just have a little bit darker
of a color and a little more intense
flavor so it's up to you cream your
butter and sugar you want to get your
butter and sugar light and fluffy it's
not gonna be super fluffy because you're
using brown sugar which doesn't get as
fluffy as granulated but it should get
significantly lighter you can make these
by hand if you have nice soft butter you
can mix everything together with a
wooden spoon proper creaming is the key
to good cookies so be patient at this
stage
not that I'm ever patient scrape and
then one more little quick mix and then
you can add your eggs to eggs one at a
time then you can add your dry
ingredients once everything is fully
combined slowly
that's it it's done oh except for all
the good stuff one cup of oats 1 cup of
toffee pieces and one cup of chocolate
chips now you could always add more if
you're a big fan of chip eNOS and who is
it
let's be honest mix probably take it off
the mixer and then just stir everything
in by hand remove your dough from the
mixer or batter give it a stir
it didn't get fully mixed in and you
want to make sure it's fully mixed in
it's it's a very stiff dough like most
chocolate chip cookie does so all right
good enough have your oven preheating to
350 degrees and then scoop onto
parchment lined baking sheets I like to
use an ice cream scoop so that all my
cookies are about the same size this is
about a two tablespoon scoop the great
thing about cookies like this is that
you can freeze them and then put them
into freezer bags and then take them out
and bake them whenever you want and you
bake them straight from frozen it just
takes a little bit more time
these cookies bake for about twelve to
fourteen minutes in a 350 degree oven
and then make sure you wait just a few
minutes before you taste them so you
don't burn yourself
here they are done let's see how they
came out
mmm-hmm can you hear that it's like a
little bit crispy but it's a little bit
chewy in the center it's the ideal
cookie give it a try
